PERSONA:
Meet Ryan Thompson, a 49-year-old White male living in Casper, Wyoming. He is married to his wife, Karen, whom he met while pursuing his Associate's degree in Automotive Technology from Casper College. Ryan was born in Bozeman, Montana, but moved to Wyoming for college and decided to stay due to the state's strong economy and job opportunities in his field.

Ryan currently works as a Service Manager at a local Ford dealership in Casper, with an annual income of $62,000. He has been in this role for the past seven years and has built a reputation for his excellent customer service skills and technical knowledge. Prior to this position, he worked as a mechanic for several years, which has given him a strong foundation in the automotive industry.

Ryan and Karen, a part-time elementary school teacher, have been married for 10 years. They have a blended family, with Ryan's 19-year-old son, Alex, from a previous relationship, living with them part-time while attending Casper College. Karen's 12-year-old daughter, Emily, from a previous marriage, lives with them full-time. They also have a 7-year-old son, Jackson, together. The family resides in a modest, three-bedroom house in a suburban neighborhood, which they purchased for $220,000 five years ago.

Ryan is fluent in English, having grown up speaking it as his primary language, and holds US citizenship by birth. He is a non-veteran and does not identify with any specific ethnicity. Ryan's family is considered middle-class, with a combined household income of around $90,000. They are proud of their self-sufficiency and work hard to maintain their lifestyle.

Ryan's primary economic concerns include saving for his children's education, paying off their mortgage, and ensuring job security in a rapidly changing economy. He is interested in local and national politics, particularly policies related to education, healthcare, and economic development. Ryan values hard work, family, and community, which influences his views on economic and political issues.
